commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Now then, I would like to begin our fifth meeting concerning the club introductions.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The school idol club president is not in attendance?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: We're sorry. She was busy and couldn't reschedule, so the two of us came in her place.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Th-Thank you for having us.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Very well. Now then, everyone, please take a look at the document in front of you.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: In this latest version, all of the issues brought up in our previous meeting have been amended.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Yes, does the head of the basketball club have something to say?

commands.speaker: Head of Basketball Club
commands.line: We have to read even more papers?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: ...Yes. I've not only made changes to the previous version, but included a number of improvements as well.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I will now go over them.

commands.speaker: Head of Basketball Club
commands.line: New points of improvement? When will we have a final copy of this thing? I don't think we normally have five whole meetings about this. We should really be practicing instead.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I know you're giving up valuable time by being here. I'm sorry. But I ask that you cooperate a little longer so we can make this event as helpful as possible for the students.

commands.speaker: Head of Basketball Club
commands.line: You always have amendments and new points of improvement, but I don't think our wishes are getting through to you.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: You could cut the tension in here with a knife.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: It is true that matters like this are usually settled in one or two meetings, so everyone may just be tired.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I see.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: For now, let's look over this document. We were late to join, so we should read everything carefully.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah, I'm looking at it. It's really informative.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Yes. However, it isn't at all complicated. It is very easy to read and understand.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: This is my first time seeing it, but everything makes perfect sense. Did Mifune write this by herself? That would be really amazing.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Yes, it is wonderfully written and truly shows her excellence. It is no wonder I was unable to beat her in the election.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I don't know about that. I think you were just as good as Mifune!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: *Chuckle* Thank you, Ayumu.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: But after taking a calm look at everything, I cannot deny that she is a step above me. It is frustrating, of course, but even I know that about myself.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I-I'm sorry.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Don't be. Your words made me very happy. You said them because you care about me, after all.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Is everyone ready? Now then, some of you are joining us today for the first time, so I would like to once again go over the important points for the club introductions.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: First and foremost, I would like for the incoming students to be able to find a clear path to their future at this school.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: In order to do that, we must foster an environment that makes it easy for them to discover what they are suited for and where their skills lie.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: They are likely interested in Nijigasaki High School in the first place because they know of our specialty courses, and are already thinking about their futures.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That is why I would like each club introduced in a way that makes it easy for students to choose the one that suits their individual needs.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: This is what I would like to request from each club.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Please provide a clear display of your club's strengths via data and graphs for all of the middle school students who will be attending the school tour.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I would also like detailed explanations of what your club tournaments are like, how those results can affect their futures, and what postgraduate options your club may unlock.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Th-This sounds nothing like the club introductions I was imagining. Is it like this every year?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: N-No. As far as I know, it isn't...

commands.speaker: Head of Literary Club
commands.line: This is not how we usually do it, but it does seem like it could get more students interested in joining our club.

commands.speaker: Head of Astronomy Club
commands.line: Everyone has to think about what they want to do after high school, after all.

commands.speaker: Head of Softball Club
commands.line: It sounds informative and parents will like it, but it's not fun. I want students genuinely interested in softball joining our club, not students worried about achievements.

commands.speaker: Head of Basketball Club
commands.line: Can't you just leave it up to each club to decide? Honestly, I don't see why the student council has any say in how my club handles its own introduction.

commands.speaker: Head of Softball Club
commands.line: I know you've put a lot of thought into this, President Mifune, but we'd at least like to decide our club introduction on our own.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I-I also agree. Our club is very fun, so I want to encourage students to join and have fun with us.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: President Mifune, it sounds like this decision would be best left to each club. I think your method would be perfect for some clubs, but for others...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I cannot allow that.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Huh?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The introductions would be unequal if the clubs did not adhere to the same format. The students would not be able to make a fair judgment.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Furthermore, you stated earlier that you wanted students genuinely interested to join your club, but I am afraid that is also not possible.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: What do you mean?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Students will be required to try out for clubs. Only those who pass may join the club.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What?! So if they fail, they can't join?!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Correct. If someone clearly lacking in talent joined, neither that student nor the club would benefit.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: But rest assured, the student council will support those students and guide them to the club best suited for them.

commands.speaker: Head of Basketball Club
commands.line: If you announce something like that, no one will want to join the clubs! Can you not see that?

commands.speaker: Head of Softball Club
commands.line: I don't want students to have to try out. I doubt students will even want to enroll at such a controlling school in the first place!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Do you think so? I disagree. Everyone needs a path free of failures that will lead them to their future.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I think mandatory tryouts would be taking it too far. You can't decide that they'll fail before they even try.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: That's right. I don't think clubs should be like that. What's most important is to have fun!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I do not understand. Who would dislike being shown the path that is most likely to lead to their success?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: We had such a long discussion, but couldn't settle on anything in the end.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Both sides... Well, the heads of the clubs at least, were getting emotional. I was feeling quite heated myself.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I really don't want interested students to have to try out. No one has the right to stop them from doing what they want to do.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: But based on that document, I can tell that Mifune doesn't have bad intentions when suggesting these things.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Yes. She has no doubts that what she is proposing is best for everyone.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: It doesn't seem like this is going to go well.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: No...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: ...Yes. I am aware of the school board's goal of attracting 300 applicants during the tour. There is no need to worry. I will take care of things on my end.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Yes. Yes, I understand. Now, if you'll excuse me.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Three hundred... I need to devise a counterplan as quickly as possible. I knew that reformation would be no easy undertaking, but I didn't think everyone would be so against it.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: But I can't give up. For the sake of Nijigasaki High School's ideals... And to save its students from feeling regret over their school lives further down the road, I absolutely cannot compromise.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Do they really think having fun is all that matters? I could not disagree more.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I don't want to see anyone else go through what my sister did.
